intro: Oncostemum arthriticum, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems that often turn reddish with age. The plant produces small, inconspicuous green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough, sandpapery texture. Oncostemum arthriticum is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
